channel.title: [PI] adding one 120 skill

item.title: [PI] adding one 120 skill
item.dc:creator: @mr_tekkah mr tekkah
item.description:
@mr_tekkah wrote:

[quote=“I Vain I”]Not really sure on this, but here’s a guess:

[code=Java]
public int getLevelForXP(int level, int experience) {
int points = 0;
int output = 0;

if (level != 3) {
    if (exp > 13034430)
        return 99;
} else {
    if (exp > 104273167)
        return 120;
}
if (level != 3) {
    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
} else {
    for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 120; lvl++) {
        points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0));
        output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4);
        if (output >= exp) {
            return lvl;
        }
    }
}
return 0;

}[/code]
Don’t replace your method with this one, just add it and see if it works. Though you will need to change the method call from getLevelForXP(int) to getLevelForXP(int, int)[/quote]

no its not working.

  1. cuz i cant use “!=” in (int exp)
    2)(int level, int experience) dont say anything about int exp
  2. idk what to do :s

but thx for tying

item.title: [PI] adding one 120 skill
item.dc:creator: @tehsandbox tehsandbox
item.description:
@tehsandbox wrote:

we are moparscape!

[quote=“mr tekkah, post:1, topic:388760”]hey rune-serv,

What i want to do? :
i want to add one skill 120 and all other’s 99 (like on rs dungeoneering)
I want this with hitpoints, so we get 120 hitpoints and all other 99.

Code:

public int getLevelForXP(int exp) { int points = 0; int output = 0; if (!getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3])) { if (exp > 13034430) return 99; } if (getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3])) { if (exp > 104273167) return 120; } for (int lvl = 1; lvl <= 99; lvl++) { points += Math.floor((double) lvl + 300.0 * Math.pow(2.0, (double) lvl / 7.0)); output = (int) Math.floor(points / 4); if (output >= exp) { return lvl; } } return 0; }

Error:

src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:2293: operator ! cannot be applied to int if (!getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3])) { ^ src\server\model\players\PlayerAssistant.java:2297: incompatible types found : int required: boolean if (getLevelForXP(c.playerXP[3])) { ^ Note: Some input files use unchecked or unsafe operations. Note: Recompile with -Xlint:unchecked for details. 2 errors Druk op een toets om door te gaan. . .

can someone help me?

thx,
Mr Tekkah[/quote]

Read full topic
